Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the restriction on research about marijuana by stating that "you can't do any research about it" due to its Schedule I classification.
Understate: The claim understates the possibility of conducting research on marijuana by implying that it is completely prohibited, when in fact there are regulations and procedures in place for conducting research on Schedule I drugs.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or data to back up the assertion that research on marijuana is completely restricted.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Schedule I classification of marijuana is the sole reason for limited research, without considering other factors such as regulatory hurdles and difficulties in acquiring plants for research.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, as it is possible to conduct research on marijuana despite its Schedule I classification, although there may be challenges and restrictions involved.
